questions.question_text:
A company implements Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management. The company is starting a short-term project that has a rigid budget.

The warehouse manager requests an environment that has demo data so that users can look at samples of the warehouse module. A cloud scale unit is not required.

You need to recommend a cost-effective environment.

What should you recommend?

choices.A: Complete project onboarding in lifecycle Services (LCS).
choices.B: Upload a new estimate to the subscription estimator.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
To deploy a solution to a Microsoft-managed UAT environment, you need to first complete the project onboarding in LCS
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/deployment/deployenvironment-newinfrastructure

Project onboarding is available for implementation projects and must be completed before any of the Microsoft-managed environments are deployed. 
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/organization-administration/onboard#lcs-implementation-project-workspace
So the answer should be A
can someone confirm or give any links?
This makes no sense - when you start a new project in LCS (minimum 20 licenses) you get a Tier2 environment included. So answer should be A if any of these..
If costs are to be minimized, why not get a tier 2 environment for UAT?`

comments.content: Tier 2 is not in the options so the next cheaper option will be Tier 3

You integrate Lifecycle Services (LCS) with Azure DevOps to test a Dynamics 365 Finance implementation.

Two new features have been implemented. You have uploaded five recordings for each feature to LCS. Testing of the new features will be completed independently. You must use the least number of artifacts possible.

You need to configure Azure DevOps to perform the tests for the new features.

Which test construct should you configure? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
You would need two test plans and two test suites12.

Test Plans: Since the two new features will be tested independently, you should create a separate test plan for each feature12. This allows you to manage and track the testing of each feature separately12.

Test Suites: Within each test plan, you should create a test suite12. Each test suite will contain the five recordings (test cases) for the corresponding feature12. This allows you to organize your test cases and run them as a group12.

A company implements Dynamics 365 Commerce. The company email provider blocks sending and receiving of AXTR files. The company disables removable storage.

A new finance employee attempts to generate deposit slips on the employee's computer but cannot.

You need to do the following:

• Capture the user's attempt to generate deposit slips on the user's computer.
• Load the capture on your computer.
• Identity the missing duties for the user.

What should you do? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
Capture the activity | Use the task recorder
Load the capture | Open the capture from Lifecycle services
Identify the missing duties of the user | Use the regression suite automation tool

I don't agree with "Load from PC". The company does not allow email of AXTR files. The recording is made from the users computer, but the analysis shall be made on my computer. How can I fetch the file if email is not allowed? I think it should be LCS.
